page.title: 14RESTENNETH PRIORY
page.content: The ruined Priory of Restenneth is a classic example of {local history}, it lies not far from Nechtansmere, an ancient battlefield. It was built as a{church}in the year AD 710 by King Nechtan, in the Saxon manner, by stone masons. The tower wasn't built until later, around the turn of the 11th and 12th centuries. Later in the 12th century it was still a small Priory for monks regular of the order of St. Augustine. It was last used as a Parish church in 1560. The{Ancient Monument}and nearby Abbot's House were donated to the Nation in 1929 via the former Ministry of Works, now Department of the Environment. It's{structure}is made of sandstone. Nowadays most of the walls have fallen down, but some still stand in excellent condition, for example the tower.
